definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Eat up high-caloric food and can't give up coke-cola.
sentences.chinese: 喫高熱量的夜宵離不開可口可樂。

sentences.english: That's because calorie-dense, high-fat, processed foods tend to be less expensive than more healthy choices.
sentences.chinese: 因爲高熱量高脂肪加工食品要比比較健康的食品便宜。

sentences.english: There's no need to drag yourself to the coffee machine for a high-octane cup of joe.
sentences.chinese: 沒有必要讓自己養成用咖啡機研製高熱量咖啡的習慣。

sentences.english: They"ll quickly adjust her thermostat to high heat.
sentences.chinese: 他們會很快調整自己恆溫器到高熱量。

sentences.english: So why do we snack, and why do we reach for the high-fat, high-sugar, high-calorie foods?
sentences.chinese: 又爲什麼非要選擇那些高脂，高糖，高熱量的食物呢？

sentences.english: Coffee drinks, fruit smoothies, and milkshakes are packed full of calories, fat, and loaded with sugar.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡，果汁和奶昔含有高熱量和脂肪，並且富含糖分。

sentences.english: I also really enjoy drinking alcohol, including some high-calorie cocktails.
sentences.chinese: 我也非常喜歡喝酒，包括一些高熱量的雞尾酒。

sentences.english: Especially designed for under-the-hood and high heat applications.
sentences.chinese: 特別設計下，在發動機罩和高熱量的申請。

sentences.english: A piece of high-quality chocolate is a good choice.
sentences.chinese: 一小塊兒高熱量的巧克力就是個不錯的選擇。

sentences.english: No fiber, low in nutrition, high in calories.
sentences.chinese: 缺少纖維素，營養物質含量低，高熱量。

sentences.english: The food served at restaurants on large plates can also contain high calorie levels.
sentences.chinese: 餐館裏大盤子裏裝的食物也含有高熱量。

definition: to put on weight/to get fat
